Choices Select

Required files

SCSS files required: _components.choices-select.scss

JS files required: choices-select.js

Choices Select structure

The Choices Select element uses the feature rich choices.js library to wrap an ordinary select dropdown.

A Choices Select element is created using an existing select and the Choices Select js module data-js-module="choicesSelect".

A Choices Select element options are defined by the data-options attribute, which accepts a JSON string in the following format:

                        [
                          {
                            "value": "1",
                            "label": "One",
                            "customProperties": {
                              "description": "One"
                            }
                          },
                          {
                            "value": "2",
                            "label": "Two",
                            "customProperties": {
                              "description": "Two"
                            }
                          }
                        ]

Where value is the value of the option, label is what is displayed and customProperties.description is what is searchable.

A Choices Select element default option is defined by the data-default attribute, which accepts the value of one of your JSON options.

You can also specify the css classes to style the outer and inner containers via the data-container-outer-class and data-container-inner-class attributes; applying the .choices-select .form__field and .form__control classes, respectively, will give the Choices Select element the same styling as other form elements.

Default Select

This is an error message.

Country Code Select

You can wrap the select, along with an input, in a div with the class .choices-country-code to create a country code phone number widget.
